results.title: The Trumpet of the swan
results.creator_credit: Richard Rich, Terry L Noss, Lin Oliver and Tiny Tot Productions
results.brief_description: Louie, a Trumpeter swan born without a voice, falls in love but has no way of communicating his emotions. Feeling despondent and at odds with his siblings with wonderful calls, he leaves home on a journey where he meets a young boy called Sam and his teacher, Mrs Hammerbotham, who teaches Louie how to speak. Learning English is not the solution to Louie’s problem however as none of the other swans can understand him. A solution is reached when Louie’s father gives his son a trumpet which he begins to play proficiently. Unbeknownst to Louie though, his father has stolen the trumpet in a moment of desperation to help his son. A stint in a jazz band and a race to reclaim his now engaged childhood love, Serena, ensues in this animated adaption of E.B. White’s classic children’s tale. Features the voices of Dee Baker, Jason Alexander, Reese Witherspoon, Seth Green, Carol Burnett, Mary Steenburgen and Joe Mantegna.

results.title: The Truly exceptional Dan Haley
results.creator_credit: John Cosgrove, James Thompson, Dave Bell Associates and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: A 16 year old who has lost 80% of his vision and will eventually be completely blind, Dan Haley does not think of himself as a handicapped person, and leads an active life. His biggest problem is that people try to do too much for him.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Cosgrove, James Thompson, Dave Bell Associates and Walt Disney Educational Media Company

results.title: The True glory
results.creator_credit: Carol Reed, Garson Kanin, Great Britain. Ministry of Information and United States. Office of War Information
results.brief_description: A joint British-American documentary account of the allied invasion of Europe during World War II compiled from footage shot by nearly 1400 cameramen. Introduced by General Eisenhower it covers all the major events of the war in Europe from the Normandy landings to the fall of Berlin. Cast includes Dwight D. Eisenhower (as himself), Robert Harris (commentator) and Peter Ustinov (as himself). (Award: Best Documentary, Features 1946 Academy Awards)

results.title: Vision. [No. 32]
results.creator_credit: Hiro Narita, Paul Ryan, Peter Schnitzler, David Holden, Donald Wrye, United States Information Agency and WH Productions
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Hydrolab - for 7 days, four young scientists live and work in an undersea hydrolab studying the coral reef off the Bahamas; Blind skiing - ski instruction to the sightless; Art squad - in Los Angeles, a number of imaginitive artists have transformed plain city walls into colorful murals; Mary Decker - a track star at the age of 15 is seen preparing for a big meet, working out with her coach, and the race itself; Primates - the Yerkes Regional Primate Centre - a research facility devoted to the study of monkeys and the great apes. Narrated by Peter Haskell.

results.title: Vision. [No. 30]
results.creator_credit: David Holden, Paul Ryan, Peter Schnitzler, Donald Wrye, United States Information Agency and WH Productions
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Henri Temianka leads an unusual orchestra of medical professionals; a Wyoming ranch hand and dog sled racer wins in finals; on-the-spot medical care for the seriously injured and ill; 50,000 school children eadch year to go out on the floating oceanographic research vessel; the story of a women’s wear firm; and the speed and precision of a ‘short-order” cook.

results.title: Seven little Australians: Eps. 1-3
results.creator_credit: Ron Way, Charles Russell, ABC and Ethel Turner Productions
results.brief_description: The story of the Woolcot family, living in Sydney in the 1890’s. An Englishman in the New South Wales Regiment, Captain Woolcot is constantly harassed and embarrassed by the antics of his seven mischievous children: Meg, Pip, Judy, Nell, Bunty, Baby and ‘The General’. Episode 1: Fowl for dinner: Captain Woolcot is embarrassed by his children’s behaviour when they interrupt a dinner he is giving for his new Commanding Officer. Episode 2: What are fathers for anyway?: Pip and Judy find themselves in trouble after leaving the General unattended in their father’s office at Victoria Barracks, while they attend a carnival. Episode 3: Consequences: Judy is sent to boarding school at Mt. Victoria, but is determined to return home.

results.title: Seven little Australians. Eps. 7-10
results.creator_credit: Ron Way, Charles Russell, ABC and Ethel Turner Productions
results.brief_description: The story of the Woolcot family, living in Sydney in the 1890’s. An Englishman in the New South Wales Regiment, Captain Woolcot is constantly harassed and embarrassed by the antics of his seven mischievous children: Meg, Pip, Judy, Nell, Bunty, Baby and ‘The General’. Episode 7: Into the sun: The doctor decides that Judy must recuperate in a warmer climate, but she is unwilling to be parted from the others. An invitation for the family to visit Esther’s parents at their country property, Yarrahappini, is accepted as a solution. Episode 8: Yarrahappini: While the Captain spends a lonely time at Misrule, his family enjoy their country holiday. Meg begins to fall in love with the property manager, Dick Gillet, but is disillusioned when she discovers he is an alcoholic. Episode 9: The Picnic: On the last day of their holiday at Yarrahappini, Esther goes to a ball with her father, and the children go off with the drovers for a picnic, which comes to a sad end when Judy is hit by a falling branch. Episode 10: Going home: Meg cares for Judy while Pip runs for the doctor, but it is too late and Judy dies. The family say goodbye to Judy and return home to their lives at Misrule.

results.title: Seven (D)
results.creator_credit: David Fincher, Arnold Kopelson, Phyllis Carlyle and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: A serial killer is murdering people according to a deranged righteous rationale, punishing people for their indulgence in the seven deadly sins. Morgan Freeman is Detective Somerset, a police officer who has seen too much crime and has witnessed for too long the savagery of a decaying urban world. Brad Pitt is young Detective Mills, eager to prove his abilities and excited to have landed a fascinating if gruesome case. “Seven” is a film that betrays an almost misanthropic contempt for the contemporary world; a world in which spirituality is infused with vengeance and where relationships are tainted by exploitation. The nameless city is always dark and wet, and begins to resemble a vision of Hell. “Seven” includes stunning photography, electrifying editing and a meticulous soundtrack. The film confronts the viewer with the hateful extremities of evil. It remains unforgettable because it also suggests that evil is not the prerogative of monsters. Co-starring Gwyneth Paltrow and a diabolically good Kevin Spacey.

results.title: With Love to the Person Next to Me
results.creator_credit: Brian McKenzie, John Cruthers and Standard Films
results.brief_description: A comical study in urban alienation and taxi etiquette. Wallace is a taxi driver who lives in a St. Kilda flat with a cast of walking wounded neighbours, all of whom are chronically disconnected like him. He drives the cab at night and spends his days making cider and listening to tapes of the conversations he records secretly in the cab. Those tapes are his only real contact with the world and they allow Wallace to connect with other people’s misery. Cast includes Kim Gyngell, Sally McKenzie, Paul Chubb, Barry Dickens and Daniel Scharf
